text.title: part2_The Raveonettes on love, death, desire and war

p.s: I do n't care about it at all because if people compared us to bands that are really shitty then I would probably mind .

But if they compare us to Buddy Holly and
The Everly Brothers
, then I think it 's fine .
You always need names for bands so you can tell people what they sound like .
I really do n't care about it one bit .

hi.s:
DS : Did you guys follow the
Phil Spector
trial ?

text.p:
Sune :
A little bit .
I did n't have any thoughts on it .
It 's 50/50

hi.s:
DS : Knowing
Ronnie Spector
it must have been an interesting perspective to see it from .

text.p:
Sune :
I 'm good friends with his daughter , and that was another weird perspective , really .
Because that was more a sad perspective because obviously she was very saddened by her dad being on trial for murder .
That was a whole different way of looking at it all of a sudden .
She 's coming tonight , actually .
I do n't know ... .
I know he has been throwing around guns for ages , so if a gun went off I would n't be surprised .
On the other hand , why would he kill someone ?
I do n't know .
I have no idea .

hi.s: DS : Dogme influenced you guys early on , does it still ?

p.s: It 's still there , a lot actually .
But I think it 's more of a subconscious , integrated thing .
It has become an integrated part of how The Raveonettes sound .
Initially it 's what created the sound and being more aware of the tools and the creative process as a Dogmeist , and the rules .
But now it 's just what happens automatically .
We tend to gravitate more towards the minimal sound and very simple things .

text.p:
Sune :
We do n't ' think about it .
It 's like if I write a song at home I do n't think it has to be in
B flat
, I just play in B flat .
That 's just a starting point , and I do n't think about it .

hi.s: DS : Are you more inspired by things in nature or man made things ?

text.p:
Sharin :
Probably more man made things than nature ...

p.s: People are sort of man made things too , I guess .

text.p:
Sharin :
Do n't you think Sune ?

Sune :
Yeah , I probably prefer man made .

Sharin :
Are you talking musically or aesthetically ?

p.s: I think with the Raveonettes there 's a lot of inspiration from man made things ...

text.p:
Sune :
They are all good in certain ways .
I use them all in different ways .
Nature does n't really inspire me to be creative , it just inspires me to relax and feel good about myself , which is a good thing , too .
I need the city and that kind of life .
